data.name: Foreword
entries: 亲爱的读者，你好，欢迎来到{@i Mimic Book of Mimics}。在这本小册子中，我汇编了属于地下城的顶级伏击掠夺者：卑微的模仿者的各种方式的模仿和变色龙行为。在这本书中，你可以找到科学领域中所有关于拟态的知识，从它的饮食，到它的狩猎策略，到它的特异功能。
可悲的是，人们对普通拟态的解剖学和生态学还没有广泛的了解。例如，许多人不知道模仿者臭名昭著的变身机制是更类似于狼人的变身诅咒，还是凝胶状立方体的僵硬而又愚蠢的幽默。因此，通过无数个小时的研究，我不仅得出了这些长期未解答的问题的答案，还发现了普通拟态的众多品种，它们以精心设计的方式进行狩猎。在这本书中，我把所有这些知识奉献给了科学事业的发展。
然而，也有反对者声称，这本书只不过是一个伪装的模仿者，等着你放松警惕，哪怕是片刻，就会对你的美味双手下手。我怎么强调都不为过：这本书并不是秘密的模仿者，就像我--盖尔-诺塔沙姆--并不是上述模仿者为使幻觉更完整而采用的文学手段。
请欣赏这本书，愿幸运之神向你微笑，因为模仿者可能潜伏在任何地方，甚至在你最不期望的地方。

data.name: Mimics
entries: 很少有怪物能像模仿者一样成为地下城探索的象征。作为一个流动的变形体，它能够复制任何地下城的设施，模仿者是地下城建筑的一部分，也是地下城生态学的一部分。有经验的冒险家知道，从字面上看，任何东西都可以成为模仿者，但根据地牢工程的潜规则，模仿者只会在最不方便的时候出现。最常见的情况是，当一行人筋疲力尽，准备领取藏在一个旧木箱里的任何奖励时。
但模仿者可不仅仅是装满财宝的箱子！他们有各种形状，从最小的（%0）到巨大的（%1%）。它们有各种形状和大小，从微小的（%0%）到巨大的（%1%）。他们可以复制宝物，从一块金币到一幅画，再到一把闪亮的新剑，他们甚至可以假装成人，有时。模仿者永远不应该被低估。
有准备的冒险者应该记住这本小册子，即（%0%）（顺便说一下，这不是一个模仿者），以了解他们的模仿者的敌人，在模仿者模仿最不希望被模仿的东西之前。

entries.name: Mimic Ecology
entries: 地牢生态系统产生了一些地球上最令人惊讶的生物，而这些生物又成为其卓越环境的组成部分。每个地牢居民，从{@creature rust monster|mm|rust monsters}到{@creature blink dog|mm|blink dogs}，都有自己独特的生物、饮食和生命周期，这使他们在同龄人中脱颖而出。模仿者也不例外；作为地牢中最奇怪的怪兽，它们的生活确实很奇怪。

entries.name: Shapeshifting
entries: 模仿者的名字来自于其不可思议的能力，不仅可以改变其身体的形状和颜色，还可以改变其皮肤的纹理。在一瞬间，模仿者可以扭曲它的整个形态，完美地复制一个无生命的物体，只是在几个小时甚至几天内保持不动。几乎没有什么限制会阻碍模仿者的转变，只要预期的形式拥有与模仿者本身相同的体积，并且没有复杂的移动部件。
这些不可思议的变化在很大程度上归功于模仿者皮肤中的一个特殊层，它包含了无数的、微小的色素器官。这些器官负责将色素输送到皮肤表面以便被看到，将色素引到身体深处以便隐藏起来，还负责生产新的色素化合物以配合环境中的材料。模仿者的皮肤甚至拥有基本的记忆，一旦受到干扰，它可以迅速将自己的形状重塑为通常认为的颜色和质地。
一旦模仿者的皮肤被转化，它就会被动地保持这种状态，不需要内部能量，直到模仿者再次转化。正因为如此，{@homebrew no one|nooone}曾见过完全未转化状态的模仿者--他们的无定形状态仍像一个融化或扭曲的物体。即使在死后，模仿者的软弱无力的身体也能保持其颜色和质地。
此外，模仿者的解剖结构从根本上说是流动的。虽然模仿者的内部并不均匀（就像渗出物一样），但模仿者拥有可塑性强的器官，在死后检查时似乎类似于油泥。这些器官中的大多数在根本上无法解释的机制上运作。有些加强了模仿体框架的硬度，以便进行长时间的转变，有些消化猎物，有些则转变为模仿体特有的眼点、牙齿和紫色的酸性表面。

entries.name: Hunting
entries: 模仿者已经进化到可以伪装成他们狩猎场上自然存在的任何家具的外观，并倾向于吸引猎物的形式。大多数冒险者认为这意味着模仿者总是将自己伪装成宝藏，但模仿者也同样可能采取拱门、壁炉、门和楼梯的形式。这样的形式就像蛇在跟踪一条精心铺设的游戏小径：猎物经常走过，很可能会忽略他们通勤时的小细节。
模仿者如果没有耐心，那就什么都不是。聪明的模仿者会在猎物孤独或易受伤害之前一直沉睡不醒，而更具攻击性的模仿者则会一直徘徊，直到猎物徘徊在他们的视野之内。但请注意：人迹罕至的地牢总是有更饥饿、更具攻击性的模仿者。
当模仿者最终显露身形时，它就会露出牙齿和假肢，抓住并撕咬过于靠近的猎物。对于没有准备的人来说，模仿者的伏击是一种死亡判决，因为在模仿者的牙齿发出致命一击之前，几乎不可能从模仿者的粘性皮肤中挣脱出来。在一次完美的杀戮中，经过短暂的挣扎，模仿者在人曾经站过的地方只留下鞋子。当然，如果有武器在手，又有警觉的盟友，大多数人都可以有机会战斗。
除非饿死，否则在被杀死之前，拟态总是会撤退的。警惕的冒险者应该尽一切努力，在逃跑的模仿者逃出视线之前将其杀死，因为一旦它逃出视线，一场致命的猫捉老鼠的游戏就随之而来。受伤的模仿者可能在任何地方或任何东西上，而且它知道每次伏击都会更聪明。冒险家们对每一个看起来不合适的物体都更加怀疑。也许模仿者会以一种不常见的物体的形式出现，也许这就是冒险家们接下来要期待的东西!

entries.name: Diet
entries: {@漫画编辑注：半身人是模仿者的一种特殊美味。

虽然常识证明，模仿者只吃冒险者，但这与事实相去甚远。冒险者太少了，而且每年都有太多的冒险者被龙吃掉了，因此不能成为可持续的食物供应。事实上，模仿者主要以其他地下城探险者为生。{@creature goblin|mm|Goblins}、{@creature kobold|mm|kobolds}、{@creature drow}、{@creature giant rat|mm|giant rats}、{@creature grimlock|mm|grimlocks}、{@creature lizardfolk}和{@creature rust monster|mm|rust monsters}都是菜单上的食物，而偶尔不警惕的{@creature bat}会成为精美的小吃。模仿者对食物根本不挑剔，但总是喜欢吃较大的人形食物。
模仿者消化食物的速度很慢，并在远离猎物的地方排泄骨头，以阻止人们的怀疑。此外，模仿者在杀戮后不会耽搁太久，因为血迹和垃圾会给其他可能的猎物带来致命的威胁。

entries.name: Mimic Reproduction
entries: 所有的拟态动物，无论哪个亚种，都是通过裂变来繁殖的：当一个拟态动物长得足够大，并且有多余的食物时，它就会无性地分裂成两个独立的拟态动物。敖包研究已经做了很多工作来阐明这一过程背后的机制，但它仍然拥有一些谜团。
其中最大和最令人困惑的是所谓的 "原始 "拟态形态，即新的拟态者在出生的那一刻所承担的形状。自然哲学家认为，模仿者，像所有其他变形者一样，有一个自然的未变形的形态，这个形态只在他们承担第一个物体形态之前的时刻被他们承担。从那一刻起，他们在物体的类似物之间转换，并且永远不会完全恢复到这种假想的状态。可悲的是，从来没有人观察到圈养的模仿者的繁殖，所以这种 "主要 "模仿形式的问题目前仍未得到证实。
{@漫画编辑注：有可能模仿者总是被改造，从他们的父母身上脱离，就像人们从椅子上折断腿一样。

entries.name: Origins
entries: 无数的历史追溯到模仿者的起源是一个不太知名的巫师、疯狂的暴君或巫师王，他在很久以前用卑鄙的魔法建造了这个生物。然而，经过仔细调查，似乎所有这些故事都是伪造的，因为它们都来自一个单一的来源。原始文本甚至没有引用它们的起源，而是以一个神话人物--疯狂的阿哈德（一个从崇拜者身上制作家具的半神）为隐喻，来解释它们对变形的非凡能力。后来的历史将这种提法美化为整个虚构的王国和战争，以解释模仿者的起源和法师的干预。因此，在这位业余历史学家的广泛努力下，我们现在离了解模仿者的起源已经不远了!
那么，你就有理由问，这些怪胎是从哪里来的。这样一种独特的生物，毕竟应该有一个独特的历史。模仿者是一种古老的怪胎，但并不能将其祖先追溯到时间的黎明。事实上，最早的历史描述了相对简单的转变和较少的生物品种。
因此，我相信模仿者的起源有几种强烈的可能性。我勉强接受的是，有可能是一个有缺陷的（%0%）咒语把一个魔法生物扭曲成了第一个模仿者，但这种篡改在实践中总是被证明是有害的，通常会产生由内而外的混合体，而不是超适应性的模仿者。也有可能是一个神的干预催生了第一个模仿者（甚至可能是神话中的疯狂的阿哈德），但今天已知的神没有直接设计出如此复杂的怪物，除了少数品种的可怕亡灵。

最后，也是最令人好奇的可能性是，模仿者只是从早期的ozes，或类似的无定形祖先中进化而来。尽管模仿者的变形看起来很神奇，但它表明了一种经过自然选择磨练的特性，能够完美地适应特定的环境--尽管是一种完全独特环境中的神奇生物。在黑暗、静止、幽闭的环境中，模仿者的捕猎效果最好，在这种环境中，他们可以欺骗和逼迫猎物。他们的伏击战术非常节省能源，使他们能够在野生动物稀少的环境中蓬勃发展。最后，虽然模仿者拥有惊人的聪明才智，但他们的本能在地牢的栖息地之外就失效了，这意味着大多数水面上的模仿者很快就会挨饿或成为食物。这种神奇的自然选择可能也是对其他怪兽的一种解释，比如（%0%）和（%1%），但这将是另一本书的主题。

entries.name: Mimics
entries: 模仿者是各地冒险者的祸根，他们是好奇的捕食者，会变身为地下城中常见的物体的形状：箱子、门，以及最常见的宝箱。一旦他们的猎物靠近，模仿者就会用他们粘稠的身体将其困住。模仿者依赖这种策略，因为它能提供充足的食物；疲惫而愚蠢的冒险者也不乏其人，也是一顿美餐。

entries.name: Punishment for Avarice
entries: 地牢学的智慧认为，模仿是对不小心的冒险者的一种因果报应，如果不是字面上的，至少也是通过比喻。在地牢里，几乎任何东西都能杀死你，从突然出现的坑道陷阱，到魔法诅咒，再到地牢里的居民。因此，模仿者为所有的地牢陷阱创造了一个整齐的说明：如果你没有仔细检查所有的东西并谨慎行动，那扇门、墙壁或宝箱可能是一个埋伏着的模仿者。

entries.name: Advanced Mimicry
entries: 模仿者的生物学特性只允许他们在完全静止时复制一个物体；一旦移动，他们的眼睛、牙齿和紫色的舌头就会完全展示出来。然而，模仿者如果在一种形态下呆得太久，就会在这种形态下变得僵硬，获得它们所选择的物体的一些特征。例如，一个长期处于桶形的模仿者将能够侧身滚动而不变形，甚至可能在等待伏击猎物的最佳机会时保留一些内容。

entries.name: Chomp!
entries: 为抓取模仿者而滚动有争议的检查会使游戏变慢（如果有几个模仿者在游戏中，会慢到爬行），这是不可避免的，所以你可以用这个变体规则来代替抓取的位置。
{@b {@i Chomp! }} 当你会被一个模仿者咬伤{@condition grappled}时，你可以立即对模仿者的逃脱DC进行力量或灵巧的救赎(你选择)，而不是被咬伤{@condition grappled}。如果失败，拟态会在你逃跑前咬住你，造成伤害，就像它对你进行了一次成功的咬合攻击。

entries.name: Intelligent Mimics
entries: 虽然大多数的模仿者{@homebrew kind}都是贪婪的怪物，但也有少数模仿者具有惊人的智慧，精通{@language Common}或{@language Undercommon}，并愿意与冒险者交谈，而不是当场吃掉他们。然而，这样的模仿者仍然是畸形的，而且几乎完全被饥饿所驱使，所以要想进行有效的交谈，必须以食物作为交换条件。一旦胃口得到满足，模仿者可能会被证明是一个宝贵的信息来源，也可能只是在冒险者经过的时候让开道路。
要制作一个智能型的模仿者，至少要给它10点智力，至少能说一种语言（通常是（%0%）），并有邪恶的倾向。为了增加乐趣，确保他们知道与地牢的陷阱、怪物或宝藏有关的关键信息，这样人物就有理由去咨询它。

data.name: Character Options
entries: 本章包含了一些不可或缺的选项，供希望在下一次与模仿者相遇时生存下来的玩家使用。它从少数几个子类开始，最后以一些有用的魔法物品结束。

entries.name: Subclasses
entries: 希望在模仿者的主场与之作战的冒险者应该配备一系列特殊的技能，以便在这样的环境中生存，并智取他们的猎物，因为他们的猎物肯定会试图智取他们。下面的子类反映了一些与模仿者和他们的变形者兄弟相对立或结盟的学科。

entries.name: Martial Archetype
entries: 不同的武者选择不同的方法来完善他们的战斗力。你选择模仿的武术原型反映了你的方法。

entries.name: Ranger Archetype
entries: 游侠的理想有很多表现形式，从灵活的双武器战士到致命的神枪手，以及两者之间的一切。

entries.name: Roguish Archetype
entries: 流氓有许多共同的特点，包括他们强调完善他们的技能，他们对战斗的精确和致命的方法，以及他们越来越快的反应。但不同的流氓将这些天赋引向不同的方向，体现在流氓原型上。你对原型的选择反映了你的关注点--不一定是你所选择的职业的标志，而是对你偏好的技术的描述。

entries.name: Sorcerous Origin
entries: 不同的巫师声称他们天生的魔法有不同的起源。虽然存在许多变化，但这些起源大多分为两类：长生的血统和异国的魔法能量的影响。

entries.name: Otherworldly Patron
entries: 不同的武者选择不同的方法来完善他们的战斗力。你选择模仿的武术原型反映了你的方法。
{@漫画编辑注：你可以通过用焦油覆盖自己并称自己为愚蠢的东西来近似于此。

entries.name: Pact Boon
entries: 在3级时，一个{@class warlock}获得了契约布恩的特性。以下是该特性的一个新选项。

entries.name: Invocations
entries: 在2级时，一个{@class warlock}的人获得了长生召唤的特性。以下是该特性的新选项。
如果一个长生召唤有先决条件，你必须满足这些条件才能学习它。你可以在满足前提条件的同时学习该召唤。

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: 仅仅提到模仿者和宝藏是分不开的。通常情况下，这使模仿者成为一个傻瓜，一个真正找不到宝藏的陷阱，但偶尔，模仿者本身就是宝藏--在{@item fraudsword, tamed|mimicbook|tamed fraudsword}的情况下，是字面意思。如果一个冒险者能获得一个（1%）或一个（2%），他们就能成为地牢环境的主人，为自己的目的采用他们最讨厌的敌人的战术。

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: 模仿者可以用它的行动来多态化为一个物体，或者回到它真实的、无定形的形态。它只能采取小型物体的外观，更喜欢绘画、雕塑和其他的形式（%0%）。它的统计数据在每种形态下都是一样的。它所穿戴或携带的任何装备都不会被转化。如果它死了，会恢复到它的真实形态。

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries: 拟态会附着在任何接触它的东西上。粘附在拟态体上的大型或小型生物也会被它{@condition grappled}（逃脱{@dc 12}）。为逃脱此抓捕而进行的能力检查有劣势。

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: 当模仿者保持不动，它与普通物体没有区别。

trait.name: Grappler
entries: 模仿者对它身边的任何生物在攻击卷轴上都有优势（%0%）。

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3})重击伤害。如果模仿者是物体形态，目标会受到其粘附特性的影响。

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}6 ({@damage 1d5 + 3})穿刺伤害。如果模仿者正在抓捕{@homebrew |to}目标，它会覆盖其头部并附着在其身上。当模仿者附着在目标身上时，目标会受到{@condition blinded}且无法呼吸，并且在模仿者的每个回合开始时，会受到14({@damage 4d6})酸液伤害。
当附着在目标身上时，除了目标之外，模仿者不能攻击其他生物。拟态的速度也变成了0，它不能从其速度的任何奖励中获益，并且它与目标一起移动。
如果目标逃脱了抓捕，它也会将模仿者从其头部分离。在它的回合中，模仿者可以通过使用5英尺的移动来将自己从目标身上脱离。

也许是最阴险的模仿者，狂躁者会复制人类的形态，通常是戴着面纱的少女、戴着低矮面罩的骑士，以及过于高贵的贵族。有时它会假装成一具尸体，身上还带着饰品，而其他时候它会扮演一个受伤的人，在地牢里迷路，以吸引猎物。这些形态甚至可以移动（尽管很不优雅），但狂躁症患者并不了解人类的一些细微之处：它不能说话（而是不耐烦地嘟囔），不能正常行走（偶尔会弓起一条腿，好像没有关节一样），也不知道要看别人对它说话。此外，它的眼睛显然是模仿者的红色和无瞳孔的眼窝。
当狂躁症患者终于有机会扑向它的猎物时，它的胸腔会张开成一个长满牙齿和卷须的大口，将猎物的整个身体咬住并咬碎。然后它可能会冒充它的受害者，从它的旅行同伴那里获得第二份食物。

The diminutive relative of the mimic, the mock is a tiny shapechanger that replicates small, valuable objects to lure its victims. In the desert, a mock might appear as a canteen of precious water, and in a dungeon, it may replicate a sizeable gemstone or a spare gold piece. With the element of surprise, a mock is just as dangerous as its larger relatives, for it can hide in far less conspicuous places.

Mocks are at their most lethal when aggregated into a ferocious {@creature mock swarm|mimicbook|swarm}, usually resembling a mound of coins or jewels. Like a school of piranha, a swarm of mocks can strip the flesh from their prey in seconds with hundreds of individual bites.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mimic's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}), {@hit 6} to hti with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

entries: As all adventurers know, mimic books don't exist. And if they did, they definitely wouldn't be filled with information detailing types of mimics in order to attract curious adventurers which rightly want insight into one of their deadliest foes. And they definitely wouldn't be waiting for you to turn to this very page before snapping down on your hands.

However, such a hypothetical mimic would surely be the cleverest of the mimics, capable of reading, and understanding terrible arcana. The more arcane secrets scrawled within one, the more powerful its repertoire of spells. Imagine if such a book were scrawled with explosive runes or with lightning bolt! But no, mimic books are merely a fiction. You simply have nothing to worry about. They're not real!

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Skin
entries: You give themselves completely over to your patron, taking on greater aspects of your benefactor in exchange for more power. Your skin changes to reflect this, changing form and becoming more resistant to damage. When you take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from a nonmagical weapon that isn't silvered, you can subtract 3 from the damage taken.

optionalfeature.name: Arachnid Step
entries: You can cast {@spell spider climb} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Fell Flight
entries: Your patron grants you the power to fly: this manifests as a pair of wings (of varying designs, a dark aura, or some other sign appropriate to your patron. While you are not wearing medium or heavy armor, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Monstrous Carapace
entries: Your already tough form becomes almost impenetrable. When you take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from a nonmagical weapon that isn't silvered, you can use your reaction to halve the damage taken.

optionalfeature.name: Sinister Snare
entries: Creatures within 5 feet of you provoke {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks} when they leave your reach, even if they took the {@action Disengage} action.

item.name: Mimic Bag of Tricks
entries: This unassuming bag, its color constantly and subtly in flux, appears empty. Reaching inside the bag, however, reveals the presence of a small, spongy object. The bag weighs 1/2 pound.

You can use an action to pull the spongy object from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. When the object lands, it transforms into a mimic that you determine by rolling a {@dice d8} and consulting the table. See the {@book Mimics chapter|mimicbook|1|Mimics|1} for the creature's statistics. The mimic vanishes at the next dawn or when it is reduced to 0 hit points.

The mimic is friendly to you and your companions, and it acts on your turn. You can use a bonus action to command how the mimic moves and what action it takes on its next turn, or give it general orders, such as to attack your enemies. In the absence of such orders, the mimic acts in a fashion appropriate to its nature.
Once three spongy objects have been pulled from the bag, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Mimic Mimic
entries: This chest features obvious eyespots, pseudopods, teeth, and a mimic's characteristic purple tongue, but is nothing more than an ordinary chest, enchanted to dissuade thieves.

item.name: Mimic Tooth Necklace
entries: This necklace is composed of plain string holding the jagged teeth of dozens of mimics. While attuned to the necklace, you have advantage on attack rolls against shapechangers, and they have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
If you help slay a mimic and add one of its teeth to the necklace, you gain access to the following additional properties while attuned to the necklace:

items: You have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, its range increases by 60 feet.
You have advantage on any ability check you make to escape a grapple or identify a shapechanger in disguise.
When you hit a shapechanger with an attack, the shapechanger takes an extra {@damage 2d6} damage.

item.name: Mimicskin Cloak
entries: This cloak is made of cured mimic hide, whose color and texture continually and imperceptibly shifts. As an action, you can polymorph into a Small{@homebrew -} or Medium-sized object of your choice for up to an hour. While polymorphed, you are indistinguishable from an ordinary object, until you move. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

item.name: Mock Pick
entries: This key, which is dotted with eyespots, can tame a hungry mimic instantly. You can use your action to insert the key into a mimic within your reach, causing it to instantly become friendly to you and your allies. If the mimic is a {@creature fraudsword|mimicbook}, {@creature bowgus|mimicbook}, or {@homebrew {@creature fool plate|mimicbook}}, it also becomes tamed, and acts as a {@filter magic item|items|source=mimicbook|search=tamed} of the same name.
Once you use a {@i mock pick}, it dissolves into the mimic and is destroyed.

item.name: Polymorph Potion

variantrule.name: Intelligent Mimics
entries: 虽然大多数的模仿者{@homebrew kind}都是贪婪的怪物，但也有少数模仿者具有惊人的智慧，精通{@language Common}或{@language Undercommon}，并愿意与冒险者交谈，而不是当场吃掉他们。然而，这样的模仿者仍然是畸形的，而且几乎完全被饥饿所驱使，所以要想进行有效的交谈，必须以食物作为交换条件。一旦胃口得到满足，模仿者可能会被证明是一个宝贵的信息来源，也可能只是在冒险者经过的时候让开道路。

subclassFeature.name: Dungeoneer
entries: Only fools would think to dive headfirst into an abandoned crypt filled with monsters and deathtraps, but it seems only fools emerge from such crypts laden with as much loot as they can carry. The archetypal dungeon delver is a veteran of such suicidal dungeon delves, and has become intimately familiar with the hazards therein. In the course of their adventures, such a dungeoneer will have adopted countless best practices, along with a litany of unproven superstitions, which they believe keeps them alive. Principles from "always be the first one to hit the monster" to "never be the first one to touch a treasure chest" line a dungeoneer's journal. Though, it's probably better to be paranoid and superstitious than lying at the bottom of a pit trap, incinerated by a {@spell fireball}, or digested by a {@creature mimic}.

entries.name: Danger Sense
entries: Beginning when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see, such as traps and spells. To gain this benefit, you can't be {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Kick in the Door
entries: Also at 3rd level, you know how to charge through each chamber of a dungeon and come out alive. When you initiate combat by kicking down a door, diving in from overhead, crashing through a window, or any other suitably reckless tactic (as adjudicated by the GM), you have advantage on your initiative roll and on attacks you make during your first round of combat. You can't gain this benefit when you are surprised or when fighting creatures you can't see.

subclassFeature.name: Dungeoneer's Intuition
entries: By 7th level, you have a second-sense fo rthe unique present in a dungeon. You have advantage on ability checks you make to detect shapechangers, traps, and unseen magical effects, and can make a check to detect such hazards even if you would not normally make such check.

subclassFeature.name: Monster Kill
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you hit an aberration, fey, fiend, monstrosity, or undead with a weapon attack, you can deal an additional die of damage to the target. You can use this ability three times, and regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Lethal Prevention
entries: By 15th level, you are a foremost expert in avoiding death. Whenever you would take damage in excess of 50 hit points, but are not killed outright, you can instead reduce the damage taken to 50 hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Avoidance
entries: Starting at 18th level, when you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

subclassFeature.name: Silverblade
entries: Silverblades root out and exterminate vampires, werewolves, and other shapeshifters which might hide in plain view. To overcome their foes' mystical defenses, silverblades practice techniques that exploit common weaknesses, such as silver and the light of the moon. But even armed with such tools, hunting their quarry is still a deadly gambit, requiring luck, skill, and deadly instinct in equal measure.

entries.name: Silverblade Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Silverblade Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

entries.name: Polymorphic Intuition
entries: Starting when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you can use your actions to focus on one creature or object you can see within 60 feet to determine if it is a shapechanger. The target can make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC to conceal its identity.

entries.name: Strike the True Flesh
entries: Also starting at 3rd level, when you roll damage for a weapon attack, you can reroll one of the damage dice once. When you roll damage for a weapon attack against a shapechanger, you can maximise one of the damage dice instead.
Additionally, your weapon attacks count as silvered for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity.

subclassFeature.name: Silvered Soul
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your soul is protected against the afflictions of shapechangers. You cannot be cursed, and you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: Moonblade
entries: Starting at 11th level, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks to cast the spell {@spell moonbeam} as a 2nd{@homebrew -}level spell, without using spell slots or spell components. If you are already concentrating on the spell {@spell moonbeam}, you can instead forgo one of your {@homebrew attack|attacks} to move the beam 60 feet in any direction.

subclassFeature.name: Eventide Charm
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can use your reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can roll {@dice 1d2|any die}. On an odd roll, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class against the attack; on an even roll, you gain a +4 bonus to Armor Class against the attack.

subclassFeature.name: The Face
entries: If you say the right things to the right people, you can shape the world as you please. As an archetypal Face, you're not only armed with honeyed words and a disarming smile, but you also know the basics of illusion and transmutation magic—anything to give you an edge in negotiations or a watertight foundation for a lie. You excel at imitation and fraud, but you'll settle for ingratiating yourself with the local nobility, if outright impersonating the king falls through.

entries.name: First Name Basis
entries: Beginning when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you can accurately recall the name and title of any creature you have ever heard of or met.

entries.name: Good with Faces
entries: Also at 3rd level, you learn to change your appearance to better suit your situation. You can cast the spell {@spell disguise self} without expending a spell slot or material components. Casting the spell in this way requires 1 minute. Charisma is your spellcasting {@homebrew ability|modifier} for this spell.

subclassFeature.name: First Impressions
entries: At 9th level, you are well{@homebrew -}practiced at the art of ingratiating yourself with others. When you meet a creature for the first time, you can gain advantage on the first Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check or the first Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Fly on the Wall
entries: Starting at 13th level, your mastery of false forms allows you to become the most innocuous of objects. You can use your action to polymorph into an object of the same size category as you or back into your true form. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying transforms with you. While transformed, you are indistinguishable from an ordinary object, and cannot attack or cast spells, but can see and hear as normal.

You can remain transformed for up to 10 minutes, all at once or in multiple transformations, each using a minimum of 1 minute from the duration. You replenish this duration when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Tongue-in-Cheek
entries: At 17th level, you become so skilled with your words that you can recover from even the most grievous of social errors. When you make a Charisma ({@skill Deception}) or Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, you can choose to gain advantage on that roll, and impose disadvantage on a listener's opposed check. You must decide to use this feature after the roll but before the GM says whether the roll succeeds or fails.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Mimicborn
entries: Your ancestry is tainted by a corruption most bizarre. Somehow, either by mad experimentation with shapechanging creatures, or through incomprehensible breeding, one of your ancestors gained the blood of a mimic, that creature of expert camouflage and punisher of avarice. As a result, your magic has bent toward transmutation, and your body is limber and can be made sticky like mimics themselves. You can even, through a combination of magic and flexibility, assume the form of objects, just like your immensely strange kin.

subclassFeature.name: Aberrant Fortitude
entries: Your body is unusually tough. At 1st level, your hit point maximum increases by 1 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Sticky Fingers
entries: At 1st level, when you hit with a melee attack, you can attempt to {@action grapple} the target of the attack as a bonus action. Additionally, any creatures you have {@condition grappled} has disadvantage on attacks against you.

subclassFeature.name: False Appearance
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can transform your appearance as an action. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this effect to become quadrupedal, for instance. At any time, you can use your action to change your appearance in this way again.

Alternatively, you can use your action and expend 1 sorcery point to take the form of an inanimate object. This object can be any shape, as long as it has the same volume as your body, and is no longer than 10 feet in any dimension. Moving or taking any action, bonus action, or reaction ends this transformation.

subclassFeature.name: Natural Transmuter
entries: By 14th level, you have a tendency for magic which transforms. When you apply metamagic to a spell which changes your form or appearance, such as {@spell polymorph} or {@spell invisibility}, you can reduce the metamagic cost by 1, to a minimum of 1.
Additionally, you can end the effects of any transmutation spell affecting you as a bonus action by expending 3 sorcery points.

subclassFeature.name: Engulf
entries: At 18th level, you can swallow and digest your foes like a mimic. You can attempt to engulf a creature that is your size of or smaller by moving into its space. You can automatically attempt to engulf a creature you are grappling. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, you move into the creature's space and it becomes engulfed: it can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes {@dice 6d6} acid damage at the start of each of tis turns. While you have engulfed a creature, you move at half speed (the engulfed creature moves with you), and you can't engulf another creature.

An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: The Symbiont
entries: Though most warlocks forge pacts with distant, intangible entities, your patron is a physical being of incomprehensible power—a being that dwells inside your very body. This arrangement was struck in the spirit of symbiosis: your patron, which resembles a muscular, living ichor, requiring a mortal dwelling, and you in turn may profit from its magic.

You can even draw your patron out from where it resides in your blood, causing it to seep forth onto your skin, until you are a monstrous hybrid of ichor and man, replete with claws and teeth to rend your foes asunder.

subclassFeature.name: Symbiotic Transformation
entries: Starting when you choose this patron at 1st level, you can draw out your Symbiont, which proceeds to coat your body in a living slime exoskeleton. You can undergo this transformation or reverse it as a bonus action on your turn. While transformed, you can't cast spells, but you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: The Flesh
entries: Your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma Modifier

entries.name: The Teeth
entries: You grow a set of knife-edged teeth, which you can use as a natural melee weapon to make bite attacks. You have proficiency in your bite attack and can use your Charisma modifier, instead of Strength, for its attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the bite deals {@damage 1d10} piercing damage, which counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

entries.name: The Claws
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you also sprout a set of wicked claws, which are natural melee weapons with the same trait as your teeth, but deal {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on a hit. When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can attack twice: once with your bite and once with your teeth.

subclassFeature.name: Traumatic Rend
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can rake your foe's eyes with your eyes to discourage its attacks. When you hit a creature with your bite and {@homebrew your|you} claws on your turn, you can make an additional attack using your claws against the target. On a hit, {@homebrew the} target has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the start of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again utnil you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Lifedrain
entries: By 10th level, your parasitic patron can draw life from those around you. Whenever you deal damage to a hostile creature using your bite or claws, you regain {@dice 1d4} hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Violence after Death
entries: Beginning at 14th level, if you should fall in combat, your Symbiont shall keep fighting. If you drop to 0 hit points while transformed with your Symbiont Transformation, you do not fall {@condition prone} or begin making death saving throws until the end of your next turn. Instead, your Symbiont controls your actions, acting as if you were not {@condition unconscious}, and attacking any hostile creatures it sees. If you take any damage while at 0 hit points, you instantly fall {@condition unconscious} and suffer one death saving throw failure. At the end of your next turn, you collapse and begin to make death saving throws as normal.
